reason: Improved memory management and clearer usage with newer APIs like bufio.Reader.Reset.
Introduced to provide error handling during scanning operations, facilitating the detection of the first non-EOF error.
To enable the efficient skipping of bytes without reading from the underlying `io.Reader`.
Improved behavior for skipping bytes by avoiding unnecessary reads from the underlying reader when possible.

ReadLine is considered a low-level line-reading primitive, and its usage may not be optimal. Developers are encouraged to use higher-level alternatives such as `Reader.ReadBytes` or `Reader.ReadString`, or leverage a `Scanner` for more convenient and robust tokenization.
The API is not included in the latest version of its module, and modern alternatives may exist to achieve the same functionality.
Enhancing the bufio package to enable skipping bytes efficiently without reading them.
Improvement in memory allocation for large tokens during scanning operations.
Improved functionality and better memory handling available through Scanner.Bytes.
Buffer memory allocation was optimized in go1.6 by introducing the `Scanner.Buffer()` method, allowing users more control over buffer size to improve scanning efficiency.
Modification of data handling to ensure proper split functionality when processing individual bytes and prevent ambiguity with erroneous encoding.
Scanner's limitations in handling large tokens prompted the use of bufio.Reader, which offers better error handling and flexibility.
This package is not available in the latest version of its module. It is possibly deprecated as newer alternatives might exist.
ScanBytes was deprecated in favor of ScanRunes due to better handling of UTF-8 encoded data and improved usage for tokenization.
ScanBytes is less commonly used and does not align with typical use cases for splitting data.
ScanBytes was deprecated due to limited use cases and the availability of more efficient alternatives for byte-level parsing.
Improved memory management and customizability using SplitFunc, allowing for greater flexibility in tokenization and error handling.
ScanBytes was deprecated to encourage the use of customizable split functions with Scanner for more flexibility in token parsing, which allows better support for various input types.
